description: Dive into "Birmingham's Picture-Perfect Moments Await" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.

places.generalDescription: Saint-Andr√© Cathedral in Bordeaux, a towering Romanesque cathedral dating back to the 11th century, may not be as grand in size as some of France's famous cathedrals, but it holds a unique and unexpected charm. Steeped in history, it was consecrated by Pope Urban II and has witnessed significant events such as the weddings of historical figures like Eleanor of Aquitaine and Louis VII.

sources.snippet: Cathedrale Saint-Andre is one of Bordeaux‚Äôs most famous cathedrals that‚Äôs perched on Place Pey Berland. It‚Äôs one of the most amazing things to see and do in Bordeaux, not just because of its sheer scale, but also its magnificent architecture and heritage that dates back centuries. Built way back in the 11 th century, the long history of the cathedral includes the wedding of Eleanor of Aquitaine to Louis VII (which you‚Äôll find out more about on your visit).
sources.shortName: 12 Best Things To Do In Bordeaux, France

sources.snippet: While I‚Äôm not a huge fan of visiting cathedrals (there are just SO many in Europe), the Bordeaux Saint-Andr√© Cathedral is really quite impressive, especially the Gothic architecture of the exterior. This cathedral is actually where Eleanor of Aquitaine married the future Louis II in 1137. You can visit the inside for free, or you can also pay to climb up its Pey Berland Tower (more about that later).
sources.shortName: 3 Days in Bordeaux, France: Most Instagrammable Places

sources.snippet: The Saint-Andr√© Cathedral, often known simply as Bordeaux Cathedral, is located at Place Bey Berland in the heart of Bordeaux city center. The Roman Catholic Cathedral of Saint-Andr√© was consecrated in 1096 by Pope Urban II; however, only a wall within the nave remains of the original Romanesque structure. The majority of the building has survived from the 14th & 15th centuries.
sources.shortName: Bordeaux Introduction Walking Tour (Self Guided), Bordeaux, France

sources.snippet: A place of historical importance in the heart of Bordeaux, the Cathedral of Saint Andrew dates back to the 12th century. Declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site, this cathedral was part of the medieval Way of Saint James pilgrimage trail. Pilgrims traveled through Bordeaux from the M√©doc, Tours, and the British Isles on their way to Santiago de Compostela in Spain.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Places to Visit in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: Saint-Andr√© Cathedral from the 12th century, the Pey Berland Tower from the 15th century, to the very innovative Darwin eco-district... Visiting Bordeaux is like taking a trip back in time!. Photographers will appreciate these unusual angles, where you can combine a historic monument and more modern facilities, to obtain a tasty mix of genres!
sources.shortName: The most beautiful photo spots in the Gironde

sources.snippet: Cath√©drale Saint-Andr√©, also known as the Bordeaux Cathedral, is a stunning Gothic cathedral located in the city centre. The cathedral is named after Saint Andrew, one of the twelve apostles of Jesus, and it is one of the most important religious buildings in the city. ‚õ™ It is also the largest UNESCO World Heritage Site in the world!
sources.shortName: Top 5 Places to Take Photos in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: Another of the Instagrammable places in Bordeaux is the Cathedral of Saint-Andre ‚Äì a really gorgeous Cathedral close to the Mama Shelter hotel right in the heart of the city centre. The cathedral is closed for a mess on Sunday (well, a part of it is open), however, it‚Äôs gorgeous from the outside!
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Spots in Bordeaux, France + Best Photo Locations

sources.snippet: Anyone that knows me knows that even though I am not religious I do love visiting churches in the cities that we visit. My mum died suddenly at my sister‚Äôs wedding. She was only 55 and, like me, loved to travel so I always light a candle for her.
sources.shortName: 2 days in Bordeaux itinerary including the best Instagram spots in Bordeaux, France with map.

places.name: Cath√©drale Saint-Andr√© de Bordeaux

reviews.text: This catholic cathedral is beautiful.  There was an organ recital with a harp while we were there. Lots of stained glass windows.  It was very peaceful. No cost.

Absolutely stunning cathedral in the heart of Bordeaux. The Gothic architecture is breathtaking, and the interior is peaceful and majestic. Make sure to visit the nearby Tour Pey-Berland for incredible views of the city. A must-see if you're in Bordeaux!

I was unfortunately visiting after a family bereavement so my opinion is probably not as positive as others would be. It's large, overwhelming at times, and is very popular. I had no real access to peace and tranquility due to the large crowds and tours operating. Like all cathedrals it begs for money constantly and is vulgar in the way it spends on making itself look attractive.

places.generalDescription: When visiting Bordeaux, one of the must-see spots is the Place de la Bourse. This iconic 18th-century city square is surrounded by elegant architecture and features a grand fountain at its center. The Palais de la Bourse, with its Neoclassical-style facade adorned with columns and sculptures, is a notable building to explore.

sources.snippet: Place de la Bourse, located in the heart of Bordeaux, is a historic square that exemplifies the city‚Äôs architectural grandeur. This magnificent square was built in the 18th century and stands as a testament to Bordeaux‚Äôs prosperous past. At the centre of the square lies the stunning Water Mirror (Miroir d‚Äôeau), an expansive reflective pool that creates captivating visual effects with its shallow layers of water.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Instagrammable Sunset Spots in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: The Place de la Bourse is a magnificent 18th-century square with a stunning view of the Garonne River. The symmetry of the buildings and the elegance of the fountain make it a must-visit Instagrammable spot, especially when beautifully reflected in the Miroir d'Eau.
sources.shortName: Top Instagrammable Spots in Bordeaux

places.name: Place de la Bourse

reviews.text: Kind an artificial pool with bunch of kids running around. Unusual and nice place - at least to see and experience this. When it gets quieter you can make amazing photos with buildings around and this part of flat water pool. Results are amazing

The 'water mirror' opposite of the bourse buildings is awesome! Such an excellent idea! This artist may get followers and copy cats all over the globe. The water is refreshing, makes the public happy and relaxed, allows kids to enjoy a city visit and provides poor citizens with a place where they can mingle with everyone else in a relaxed way. It also gives enough water for great flowers and the gardens/park pieces next to the water mirror. And, when quiet, the reflection doubles the grandeur of the bourse buildings. Best place of Bordeaux in my opinion.

I love Bordeaux (both the wine & the city). For me Bordeaux remains one of the nicest cities in France through the years.
Thanks to the local positive management ! I would highly recommend visiting for any person.

places.address: Pl. de la Bourse, 33000 Bordeaux, France

places.generalDescription: Located in Bordeaux, the Miroir d'eau is a large shallow reflecting pool built in 2006 near Place de la Bourse. Covering an area of 3450 square meters, it is one of the world's largest reflecting pools and offers stunning views of the surrounding architecture. The water's surface acts as a mirror, creating beautiful visual effects and making it a popular spot for photography.

sources.snippet: Haut lieu touristique soulignant un front de Garonne du XVIII, vous ne pouvez pas faire l‚Äôimpasse !. Vous l‚Äôavez.Vous allez r√©galer Instagram !

The water installation creates either a beautiful reflection or dreamy fog, both are very beautiful to snap. During the weekends, Miroir d‚ÄôEau is a popular spot for locals and lots of children play in the water, which can make it hard to take photos.

It is the world's largest reflecting pool, which makes it one of the top must-see spots in Bordeaux. Water Mirror was designed by Michel Corajoud and constructed by Jean-Max Llorca.

places.name: Miroir d'eau

reviews.text: A brilliant idea in combining a modern structure with the old buildings on the other side of the square. When there is no wind, the buildings are reflected in the water. It is very beautiful, as are the blooming gardens along the embankment. A wonderful space for walking!

Fascinating creation right next to the river. You can see a clear reflection of people and buildings, if it is not too windy. They have two different exhibitions, a mist spray followed by about 2cm deep of water coming up from the bottom.

Patiently waited while others came and went.  Worthwhile confirming times online and what happens! I could have waited as long as needed.  When the water fills,  wait till its still.  As it emptied,  there were still moments.  Then the mist! Time it all between cars,  trams, trucks and buses

places.generalDescription: The Op√©ra National de Bordeaux - Grand-Th√©√¢tre is a stunning neoclassical building with a facade dating back to 1780. It serves as a venue for operas, dance performances, and music concerts. The theater is an essential part of Bordeaux's cultural scene and boasts an impressive permanent staff including musicians, dancers, and singers. With its grand architecture and diverse range of performances throughout the year, it remains one of the most popular attractions in the city.

sources.snippet: Navigate from the iconic National Opera of Bordeaux capturing its elegant neoclassical architecture to the emblematic Pont de Pierre renowned for its grand arches spanning the river. Uncover their unique roles in the daily life of locals, from being a beloved meeting point to a scene straight out of a postcard. Experience Bordeaux intimately, as your Local reveals the stories behind famed postcard scenes, blending photogenic imagery with personal anecdotes.

reviews.text:
For me it was the best architectural monument to see in Bordeaux... Highly recommended to buy advance tickets if you want to enter inside.
Obviously for me the best view was at night when all the lights were lit up.

The Grand Th√©√¢tre de Bordeaux is a stunning building with impressive architecture and rich history. The details inside are truly breathtaking, and it's definitely worth a visit for anyone who appreciates classical design.
However, we were disappointed that access was very limited-we could only see a small part of the theater instead of exploring more of the beautiful spaces.
Still, it's a must-see landmark in Bordeaux, and if you can catch a performance, it's probably even better!

I took a visit, not an opera performance. The architecture of the building is very interesting and beautiful but the experience was not that pleasant. The guide was late, I had to follow him during all the time (I prefer to take my time to enjoy the place). Even other guide come tell him that we can't stay there in that moment...

places.generalDescription: In the heart of Bordeaux's Triangle d'Or, surrounded by historic landmarks and elegant architecture, stands the Monument aux Girondins. This grand monument pays tribute to the Girondin revolutionaries with its towering column and intricate fountain featuring bronze sea horses. Nearby, the Esplanade des Quinconces offers a vibrant setting for various events, while the Place des Quinconces boasts as one of Europe's largest open squares.

sources.snippet: Au centre de la plus grande Place d‚ÄôEurope, celle des Quinconces, cet imposant monument embl√©matique est le sujet parfait. Ce qui fait tout son charme : son imposante colonne, sa fontaine orn√©e de la Garonne et la Dordogne et ses chevaux marins. Un petit filtre pour donner encore plus de potentiel au bronze, le sunset en toile de fond, et c‚Äôest une pluie de likes garantie !
sources.shortName: Les 10 spots les plus instagrammables de Bordeaux !

sources.snippet: Direction la place Quinconces, la plus grande d‚ÄôEurope pour capturer ce majestueux monument de la ville. Le monument aux Girondins est imposant de par ses 43 m√®tres de haut et surplombe la majestueuse fontaine orn√©e de ses chevaux marins et ses groupes de bronze. Sa colonne, sa fontaine et ses jets d‚Äôeaux en font un immanquable pour un clich√© splendide !
sources.shortName: Bordeaux : 11 spots photo instagrammables

sources.snippet: The Place des Quinconces is one of the largest squares in Europe. It‚Äôs pretty bare most of the time, but there‚Äôs sometimes a small amusement park, and there‚Äôs always an overpriced ferris wheel and an impressive fountain. The Monument aux Girondins is dedicated to the Girondin victims of the Reign of Terror.
sources.shortName: 3 Days in Bordeaux, France: Most Instagrammable Places

sources.snippet: You can find the Girondins Monument at the Place de Quinconces, which is one of the largest city squares in Europe. The Monument remembers the Girondins that were killed during the French Revolution. The Monument also features a fountain.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Places in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: Situ√© sur la place des Quinconces, se dresse le c√©l√®bre monument aux Girondins. Cette imposante colonne rend hommage aux Girondins de la R√©volution. Avec ses fontaines et ses sculptures, c‚Äôest le sujet parfait pour votre compte Instagram.
sources.shortName: Les 10 spots les plus instagrammables de Bordeaux | Bordeaux M√©tropole

places.name: Monument aux Girondins

reviews.text:
The Monument aux Girondins in Bordeaux offers an impressive sight with its 54-meter column topped by a Liberty statue and the detailed bronze fountain featuring horses and human figures.

Located in the spacious Place des Quinconces, the surrounding trees and rostral columns add to the setting.

It's easily accessible by tram and free to visit, making it a convenient stop. It's a decent spot for a quick look if you're in the area.

This is a important monument and Historical Monument in Bordeaux that is very interesting to see while sightseeing around the city centre.

It was erected between 1894-1901 and is dedicated to the Girondian victims of the Terror associated with the French Revolution.

What you see is a decorative 43-metre tall column topped with a bronze statue of the angel Liberty, breaking free from her chains.

At the base, there are female figures as well as two basins upon which you will see busy composition of bronze figures as well as horses bursting forward.

The basins were well dry and unused during our September visit, might have been turned off for the upcoming winter season. Would be quite interesting to see when filled with water.

I like the view and sculptures better from the north side. The horses' hooves and tails are something to behold. I can also tell it is a well known meet up spot for tours and such.

South from here is a nice walk around old town. This fountain is a good starting point for a stroll around Bordeaux and is most likely its most well known landmark!

places.generalDescription: Jardin Public is a serene oasis in the heart of Bordeaux, established in 1746 and spanning 11 hectares. It boasts a harmonious blend of 18th-century architecture, diverse flora from around the world, and the impressive Orangerie terrace. This historic green space is surrounded by elegant Bordeaux residences and features an arboretum, sculptures, a picturesque lake with swans, charming footbridges, a children's play area with a vintage carousel, and a designated area for dogs.

sources.snippet: Vous voil√† maintenant √† deux pas du Jardin Public.Havre de paix en plein centre de Bordeaux, de nombreux th√®mes photos sont abordables. L‚Äôactivit√© physique : depuis le confinement, les Bordelais font leurs sports seuls, √† plusieurs ou avec un coach.Mais aussi la danse de nos chers enfants, le farniente, la lecture, les jeux pour les plus petits, l‚Äôespace botanique et le joli petit mus√©e Science et Nature vous attendent.Je ne m‚Äôy suis jamais attard√©, pourtant de vraies possibilit√©s de photos de rue existent. Autre chose.Avec un peu de chance vous devriez entendre des cris d‚Äôenfants du c√¥t√© de l‚Äôentr√©e.C‚Äôest le Guignol Gu√©rin, j‚Äôy suis all√© quelques fois avec mes gamins.
sources.shortName: Visiter Bordeaux en 30 Spots photos

Alors si tu ne r√™ves que de verdure et d‚Äôun petit havre de paix au c≈ìur de la ville, c‚Äôest ici qu‚Äôil faut te rendre. Fleurs, verdure, paysages champ√™tres, arboretum, biblioth√®que, Mus√©um d‚Äôhistoire naturelle, balan√ßoires ou encore man√®ges venus d‚Äôun autre temps : impossible de ne pas trouver l‚Äôinspiration dans cet √©crin de verdure.

Parce qu‚Äôen ce moment, c‚Äôest vraiment tout ce dont on a besoin !. Avec son arboretum, sa biblioth√®que, son Mus√©um d‚ÄôHistoire naturelle, son th√©√¢tre de marionnettes, ses balan√ßoires et man√®ges √† l‚Äôancienne, c‚Äôest le buzz sur Instagram assur√© !

sources.snippet: Yup, every city has a park but what makes the Jardin Public so special is its size and what‚Äôs inside. Not only is it the perfect little spot to stroll around the city‚Äôs green spaces, it actually holds an arboretum, library and the Museum of Natural History to explore too. You can easily spend a day just wandering around all these spots.

Designed in the French classical style, this lush green oasis offers a serene escape from the bustling city. Jardin Public is known for its beautifully landscaped gardens, charming pathways, and picturesque lakes.

places.name: Jardin Public

reviews.text:
It is a lovely park. It's located in the heart of the city, near place Quinconces. In this early spring, birds are singing and flowers are about to blossom. There is a small river which makes the park very charming. On the bank, ducks, geese are fighting with pigeons for food. Habitants and their dogs both enjoy their social activities...
What a peaceful life here!

Beautiful park, quite spacious. A culture shock for me was people in bathing suits  üëô  on the lawn sunbathing! (As a South African)

At first I thought "there has to be a swimming pool in this park with so many people in bathing suits" turn out no üòÑüòÑ
My favorite park in Bordeaux. It's lovely and well maintained. It's great to walk or just sit and relax. The botanical gardens were a wonderful surprise.

places.generalDescription: Basilique Saint-Michel, located in Bordeaux's Saint Michel district, is a stunning Gothic basilica dating back to the 14th century. This architectural marvel features an impressive 114-meter tower that offers panoramic views of Bordeaux. The basilica boasts intricate details such as stained-glass windows and ornate carvings, making it a captivating site for visitors.

sources.snippet: Although nearly everyone visiting Bordeaux will see the Bordeaux Cathedral (after all, it can be spied from pretty much), fewer people have heard of the Basilique Saint Michel (translated as Saint Michael‚Äôs Basilica). Situated in the Saint Michel district of the city, the ecclesiastical building and its adjacent tower were built between the 14th and 16th-centuries. Constructed in a particularly elaborate style, within the basilica there are several beautiful stained glass windows and an impossibly high nave.
sources.shortName: 10+ Secret Spots in Bordeaux You Must Visit in France

sources.snippet: Exemplifying an extravagant Gothic style, this basilica dedicated to the Archangel, is another important church on the Camino de Santiago pilgrimage trail. The Basilique Saint-Michael is a designated UNESCO World Heritage Site. Built over a period of 200 years, from the 14th to 16th centuries, the basilica presents a pleasing unity of "Flamboyant Gothic" architectural elements.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Places to Visit in Bordeaux

places.name: Basilique Saint-Michel

reviews.text: Amazing stained glass much of which is from around the 50s, so looks almost like if Picasso designed them.  A beautiful church although the bell tower was under reconstruction when we visited, but the windows alone were worth the visit. Also the red and white tiles floor was very interesting.  Certainly a place to visit while walking around Bordeaux, and very close to the Marche des Capucins.

A beautiful church to visit, although the separate bell tower was under reconstruction when we were there.  There's some amazing stained glass, much of it appears new after the church was bombed in the war.. Certainly a place to visit while walking around Bordeaux and make sure you put a couple of Euros in the box for the organ repairs

Wonderful work in progress to restore/recreate this Basilica still bearing the marks of WW2 (and more than a bit of neglect I suspect).  Its inherent character combined with the interpretive narrative literally built into its recreation this has every chance of becoming one of the magnificent churches of Europe.  It's lovely and evocative above its historic and spiritual echos one can imagine a remarkable rebirth that appears in progress.

places.generalDescription: Place du Parlement, a historic square in Bordeaux named after the Bordeaux Parliament, is a popular spot for locals and tourists alike. The square is surrounded by bars, restaurants, and cafes with terraced seating. It's located in the Saint-Pierre district and is just a short walk from the Grand Theater. Visitors can explore nearby small streets and squares like Place Saint-Pierre, Place du Palais, and Place Camille-Jullien.

sources.snippet: While also not a specific restaurant, Place du Parlement is a lovely square with several eateries and shops. I particularly like Jolly, a cafe with many vegan ice cream and traditional French dessert options.
sources.shortName: 3 Days in Bordeaux, France: Most Instagrammable Places

places.name: Place du Parlement

reviews.text: Very nice square with nice caf√©s and shops.
Amazing resaurant lovely friendly staff. Food was exceptional. Beautiful view of the cathedral. Highly recommend

Really nice city, Bordeaux is lovely to watch. It has a very good public transport, reliable and cheap. The city centre is well maintained and clean with lots of things to see/visit. Place du Parlement is worth it to be seen.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Bordeaux, Grosse Cloche, or "Big Bell," is a captivating historical landmark that dates back to the 15th century. This impressive bell and clock tower was originally part of the city's medieval fortifications and served as an alarm system for fires. Weighing an astonishing 7.75 tons, the bell rings on special occasions like Remembrance Day and Fete Nationale, echoing stories from centuries past.

sources.snippet: One of the remnants of medieval Bordeaux, the Grosse Cloche (Big Clock) is a monument built in the 13th and 15th centuries and has been restored to its former glory. The most distinctive features of this ancient gate tower are the clock and the bell (weighing over 7,000 kilos), which is rung for special celebrations such as Remembrance Day (November 11th) and the F√™te Nationale (July 14th). The Grosse Cloche once served as a prison and is redolent with stories from centuries past.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Places to Visit in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: Un des lieux les plus touristiques de Bordeaux.Cette magnifique porte, photographi√©e sous tous les angles, entame la rue St James.Un ou deux clich√©s de la cloche et progressez dans le passage vers la place Fernand Lafargue puis vers la place de la ferme Richemond.La premi√®re place est tr√®s anim√©e et √©tudiante, l‚Äôoccasion de vous planter et de p√™cher quelque chose.La seconde est beaucoup moins bruyante et j‚Äôy ai toujours fait quelques tirages int√©ressants.Allez savoir pourquoi‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Visiter Bordeaux en 30 Spots photos

sources.snippet: Possibly one of the very oldest belfries in the region, the Grosse Cloche de Bordeaux is one of the many things to see in Bordeaux ‚Äì and it‚Äôs totally free and easy to spot too!. Beautiful erected in 1775, this gatehouse was crafted with two clocks and a bell tower; which replaced a previous building that was damaged by fire long ago in the 18th century. A nearby plaque has the inscription that ‚Äòthe bell was the bearer of all good and bad tidings to the people of Bordeaux.‚Äô
sources.shortName: 12 Best Things To Do In Bordeaux, France

sources.snippet: La Grosse Cloche, meaning ‚ÄúThe Big Bell‚Äù in French, is an iconic medieval bell tower located in the heart of Bordeaux. This historic monument dates back to the 15th century and stands as a symbol of the city‚Äôs rich heritage and architectural significance. Originally part of the city‚Äôs defensive walls, La Grosse Cloche served as a gateway into the medieval town and has since become one of Bordeaux‚Äôs most recognisable landmarks.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Instagrammable Sunset Spots in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: The Latin inscription on the inside of the Grosse Cloche (literally ‚ÄúBig Bell‚Äù) reads ‚ÄúI ring the hours and my voice is a call to arms, I sing for happy events and weep for the dead‚Äù. The bell was cast in 1775 and weighs no less than 7,750 kilos!. Christened ‚ÄúArmande-Louise‚Äù, it rings 6 times a year for major celebrations such as Bastille Day, VE Day, and Remembrance Day and also the first Sunday of each month at noon.
sources.shortName: 2 days in Bordeaux itinerary including the best Instagram spots in Bordeaux, France with map.

sources.snippet: La Grosse Cloche, or the Big Bell, is the name given to a 7800 kg iron bell housed in a medieval belfry. It stands on the Saint Eloi passage, with an archway in the bell tower allowing pedestrian access through the monument. This was once the Porte Saint Eloi, a gate into the city center in the Middle Ages.
sources.shortName: Bordeaux Introduction Walking Tour (Self Guided), Bordeaux, France

sources.snippet: Before becoming a modern 18th-century city with spacious squares and boulevards, Bordeaux was once a little town. The old town was surrounded by ramparts with impressive entrance gates. Today, five of the gates are still standing, marking the old borders of Bordeaux.
sources.shortName: 50 best things to do in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: This is another castle-like structure that serves as a gate. The Grosse Cloche was cast in 1775 and weighs 7,750 kilos (17,086 pounds!!). The bell is rung only 6 times a year, for major events like Bastille Day, VE Day (end of WWII), and Remembrance Day (end of WWI).
sources.shortName: 3 Days in Bordeaux, France: Most Instagrammable Places

sources.snippet: Grosse Cloche is a very photogenic clock tower in the city centre of Bordeaux. It‚Äôs located in a narrow street, between two rows of beautiful medieval buildings and it looks really stunning. Head there in the morning when there‚Äôs no one to take a great photo there.
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Spots in Bordeaux, France + Best Photo Locations

sources.snippet: La Grosse Cloche (1795) , and Porte Cailhau (1495) are pieces of history you may walk under during your stroll around town. They are magnificent memorials to the medieval history of Bordeaux, one used as a jail, the other as a defensive bat√Æment.
sources.shortName: Holman Photo On The Go| Travel photos and reviews| Bordeaux, France Recommend

sources.snippet: Be aware that after a certain time in the morning there are already several groups of tourists on guided tours, so it is best to go early to get photos without anyone.
sources.shortName: Ultimate Guide to the Best Photo Spots in Bordeaux

places.name: Grosse Cloche

reviews.text: ‚ÄúLarge Clock‚Äù as it's called is a towering gate from old Bordeaux. Amazing architecture that has withstand the test of time. Definitely worth visiting while in old town Bordeaux.
A beautiful bell tower and gate from the old city wall of Bordeaux.   The bell is seldom used now but the tower and the gate remain.   A great place to visit.

This is a neat bell tower to see, especially on the first Sunday of each month. That's when they actually ring it at noon. There are neat book stores & eateries down the street from the bell. We sat outside and had breakfast with a perfect view of it. Also, about a block down Victor Hugo Rue there is a Falling Car poking out of a parking garage that's fun to find and see!

places.generalDescription: Pey Berland Tower is a 15th-century Gothic bell tower located in the historic neighborhood of Pey-Berland, near the Cathedrale Saint-Andre. Visitors can climb 233 spiral stairs to reach the top and enjoy panoramic views of Bordeaux. The area surrounding the tower is rich in history and culture, with nearby museums like Musee d'Aquitaine and Musee des Beaux-Arts, as well as charming cafes, boutiques, and art galleries.

sources.snippet: Drink in a panoramic view of the city from atop the Tour Pey-Berland. This still-functional 15th-century bell tower is a prime vantage point for orienting yourself, and the terrace‚Äôs helpful monument markers make scouting out the city‚Äôs key sights a breeze, so consider visiting at the beginning of your stay. Entry is ‚Ç¨6 (¬£5.25) per person, but if you‚Äôre under the magic age of 26 and an EU citizen you can climb the tower for free.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best Things To Do In Bordeaux France

sources.snippet: This richly decorated tower is the freestanding belfry for the Cath√©drale Saint-Andr√©. Built in the 15th century for the Archbishop Pey Berland, the UNESCO-listed tower exemplifies Flamboyant Gothic architecture with its ornate details, soaring spires, and angled corner buttresses. As a more recent addition, a 19th-century statue of Notre Dame d'Aquitaine adorns the top of the tower.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Places to Visit in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: Saint-Andr√© Cathedral from the 12th century, the Pey Berland Tower from the 15th century, to the very innovative Darwin eco-district... Visiting Bordeaux is like taking a trip back in time!. Photographers will appreciate these unusual angles, where you can combine a historic monument and more modern facilities, to obtain a tasty mix of genres!
sources.shortName: The most beautiful photo spots in the Gironde

sources.snippet: Take a little stroll back to the Cath√©drale Saint-Andr√©, and climb up Pey Berland Tower for a birds-eye view of the city (and the cathedral).
sources.shortName: 3 Days in Bordeaux, France: Most Instagrammable Places

places.name: Tour Pey Berland

reviews.text: The view in the top of the tower is beautiful, the ticket is 9‚Ç¨ but it's on the first Sunday of each month. In my opinion, this is one of those thing you need to do before leaving Bordeaux (And you will do good exercise by the way üòÖ)

Reaching the top of Tour is no easy feat, but the panoramic views of the city are breathtaking. The narrow stairs and passages add to the challenge, but it's well worth the effort. A must-visit for anyone looking to experience in center of Bordeaux.

Interesting climb and information at the second level.  Could see much of the city and another beautiful view of the church next door.  I hate heights but took in the wonderful view anyway.  Quite a workout as it is 9 stories straight up a spiral staircase to the first tier, then another few to the top. Stairs are a bit uneven, but ok if you take your time and be careful.

places.generalDescription: Cit√© du Vin is a cutting-edge wine museum housed in a striking curved aluminum and glass structure in Bordeaux. It offers interactive displays, guided tours, and tastings to educate visitors about the history and production of wine globally. The museum's modern design reflects the swirling motion of both the adjacent Garonne River and wine in a glass. With themed routes and multimedia exhibits, it explores wine's impact on history, geography, culture, and civilization.

sources.snippet: Avec son architecture unique en son genre, pas √©tonnant que cet √©difice majestueux soit des plus photographi√©s !. Avec ses courbes audacieuses, sa rondeur sensuelle et le jeu de reflets qu‚Äôoffre sa monumentale structure en acier, l‚Äô√©difice de la Cit√© du Vin fait sans conteste partie des plus instagrammables. 55 m√®tres de haut, 85 m√®tres de long, il s‚Äôagit l√† d‚Äôun sujet monumental, de ceux qui nous rendent si fiers #bordeauxmaville !
sources.shortName: Les 10 spots les plus instagrammables de Bordeaux !

sources.snippet: D‚Äôailleurs, si vous √™tes passionn√© d‚Äô≈ìnotourisme, d√©couvrez dans cet article 7 ch√¢teaux viticoles √† visiter pr√®s de Bordeaux. La cit√© du vin est nich√©e dans un b√¢timent √† l‚Äôarchitecture unique et particuli√®rement √©tonnante. Cet √©difice est tr√®s photographi√©, avec ses belles courbes, ses jeux de reflets et son audacieuse structure en acier, le b√¢timent remarquable fait partie des lieux les plus instagrammables.
sources.shortName: Bordeaux : 11 spots photo instagrammables

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre a big fan of wine and wine history, the Cit√© du Vin museum is definitely your spot. Here, you can learn all about how wine is made, the different wine regions in France, and the history behind wine‚Äîall through artifacts and multimedia displays. Tickets cost 9‚Ç¨ for kids, 22‚Ç¨ for adults, or 54‚Ç¨ for 2 adults and kids.
sources.shortName: 3 Days in Bordeaux, France: Most Instagrammable Places

sources.snippet: Most famous is La Cit√© du Vin, the interactive wine museum that opened in 2016. But with museums like the Natural History Museum, Contemporary Art Museum, Science Museum and Maritime Museum, there‚Äôs sure to be at least a few to tickle your fancy. We haven‚Äôt even been to all of them yet, but we‚Äôre working on it.
sources.shortName: A Local's Guide to the Top Things to Do in Bordeaux by

sources.snippet: You will definitely need to use your city pass to visit the Cit√© du Vin, Bordeaux‚Äôs very own wine museum. It is the furthest located of all of the best Instagram spots in our Bordeaux itinerary but it is most certainly worth a visit. See I promised you there would be wine!
sources.shortName: 2 days in Bordeaux itinerary including the best Instagram spots in Bordeaux, France with map.

sources.snippet: Si vous cherchez √† faire une photo embl√©matique de Bordeaux, rendez-vous √† la Cit√© du Vin‚Äâ!. Avec son architecture audacieuse, ce lieu incarne √† lui seul l‚Äôesprit de Bordeaux. Le b√¢timent tout en courbes et en rondeurs √©voque le vin qui tourne dans le verre.
sources.shortName: Les 10 spots les plus instagrammables de Bordeaux | Bordeaux M√©tropole

sources.snippet: Ce mus√©e d√©di√© au vin, inaugur√© en 2016 (Quoi de plus normal √† Bordeaux !), s‚Äô√©l√®ve sur 8 √©tages. Vous y d√©couvrez toute l‚Äôhistoire du vin √† travers le monde, mais aussi des cultures. Son architecture unique a attir√© pr√®s de 450 000 visiteurs en 2017.
sources.shortName: 10 Spots Photo √† Bordeaux pour illuminer votre Instagram

sources.snippet: The Cit√© du Vin is a modern, innovative building dedicated to the world of wine. Its unique architecture, both inside and out, makes it a highly Instagrammable spot. Don't miss the panoramic view from the top floor, overlooking the entire city.
sources.shortName: Top Instagrammable Spots in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: D√©couvrir le patrimoine gastronomique bordelais tout en buzzant sur Instagram ?. C‚Äôest possible, gr√¢ce √† la Cit√© du vin. Sur 8 √©tages, tu pourras d√©couvrir l‚Äôhistoire de cette boisson ancestrale √† travers le monde et les cultures.
sources.shortName: Bordeaux : le top des spots instagramables pour faire de l'ombre aux influenceurs

sources.snippet: This impressive hangar is located just in front of the famous Cit√© du Vin and hosts more than 20 different artisans and merchants who were chosen for the quality of their products.
sources.shortName: 50 best things to do in Bordeaux
12 Best Things To Do In Bordeaux, France

places.name: Cit√© du Vin

reviews.text:
Cit√© du Vin ‚Äì A Must-Visit in Bordeaux City

Cit√© du Vin is a destination you simply shouldn't miss when visiting Bordeaux. As a modern wine museum, it offers a unique and immersive way to explore the world of wine-its history, culture, and influence across different civilizations.

It makes learning about wine not only accessible but genuinely fun. The exhibitions are engaging and interactive, offering insights not just into French wine history, but also fascinating stories from wine cultures around the world.

There are plenty of hands-on activities throughout, making it an enjoyable experience for all ages. With your entry ticket, you can even exchange it for a drink-wine or juice-at the top floor bar, where you'll enjoy your sip with a beautiful panoramic view of Bordeaux. A perfect way to end your visit!

A fabulous experience with lots of interactive stations. The perfect museum for grown ups with a few wine tastings included. Recommend the sensory experience it was very interesting & the wines were very unique. Will definitely go again as we didn't cover everything in one visit.

Really modern and interactive museum. Visited with the Bordeaux City Pass which I think is great for first time visitors. Convenient location right on the Tram B line. We went soon after open around 10:30 on a Friday and it wasn't too busy. By the time we were going upstairs to the top floor for our included glass of wine, it felt much busier. Staff was friendly and the museum was clean. Although there were young children, I am not sure it's the best bet for them. The information is geared towards adults.

places.generalDescription: The Pont de Pierre, also known as the Stone Bridge, is an elegant and historic bridge in Bordeaux. Commissioned by Napoleon, it features 17 spans that gracefully cross the River Garonne. This early 19th-century bridge has become a pedestrian-friendly destination since 2017, offering visitors a serene escape from the city center. A leisurely walk across the Pont de Pierre provides stunning skyline views of Bordeaux over the river, especially enchanting after dark.

sources.snippet: Escape the hustle and bustle of the city centre with a walk across Bordeaux‚Äôs oldest stone bridge, the Pont de Pierre. This early 19th-century bridge was finally closed to all traffic other than pedestrians and public transit in 2017, transforming it into the ideal destination for carefree promenades and the obligatory skyline photo shoot. Save your walk until after dark by savouring a few drinks beforehand at nearby speakeasy CanCan ‚Äì you‚Äôll be treated to a view of the city glittering over the Garonne River, a sight difficult to get from any other location in Bordeaux.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best Things To Do In Bordeaux France

sources.snippet: Navigate from the iconic National Opera of Bordeaux capturing its elegant neoclassical architecture to the emblematic Pont de Pierre renowned for its grand arches spanning the river. Uncover their unique roles in the daily life of locals, from being a beloved meeting point to a scene straight out of a postcard. Experience Bordeaux intimately, as your Local reveals the stories behind famed postcard scenes, blending photogenic imagery with personal anecdotes.
sources.shortName: Bordeaux: Capture the most Photogenic Spots with a Local

sources.snippet: Pas tout neuf (il date de Napol√©on 1er), la circulation y est interdite pour plus de s√©curit√©. Pour ne pas dire qu‚Äôil n‚Äôest pas franchement en bon √©tat.Aventurez-vous dessus avec votre pas le plus l√©ger (on ne sait jamais‚Ä¶)S‚Äôoffre √† vous le magnifique front de Garonne ainsi que de belles lumi√®res sur le fleuve. Avec un peu de chance et si vous √™tes matinal, vous aurez la possibilit√© de r√©aliser une photo de Bordeaux dans le brouillard.
sources.shortName: Visiter Bordeaux en 30 Spots photos

sources.snippet: Pont de Pierre, meaning ‚ÄúStone Bridge‚Äù in French, is a historic bridge that spans the majestic Garonne River in Bordeaux. Built in the early 19th century, this architectural marvel played a significant role in connecting the two banks of the river and facilitating transportation and trade in the region. Its construction was ordered by Napoleon Bonaparte himself, showcasing its historical importance and cultural significance.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Instagrammable Sunset Spots in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: Une promenade sur le pont, √† pied ou √† v√©lo, pendant la golden hour, la Garonne en premier plan, ses arches classiques et ses cand√©labres en second‚Ä¶ Pas besoin d‚Äôun filtre vintage ici pour vous faire remonter le temps !. Et si au contraire vous souhaitez accentuer le contraste, le tramway passant sur le pont de pierre est tout un classique sur Instagram !
sources.shortName: Les 10 spots les plus instagrammables de Bordeaux !

sources.snippet: If you walk beneath Porte Cailhau towards the river, you‚Äôll soon see Pont de Pierre, a bridge leading to the other side of the river. It‚Äôs the oldest bridge in Bordeaux, and was the only bridge to cross the river Garonne until 1965. Designed under Napoleon Bonaparte, Pont de Pierre has 17 arches‚Äîone for each letter in Napoleon‚Äôs full name.
sources.shortName: 2 days in Bordeaux itinerary including the best Instagram spots in Bordeaux, France with map.

sources.snippet: If you walk beneath Porte Cailhau towards the river, you‚Äôll soon see Pont de Pierre, a bridge leading to the other side of the river. It‚Äôs the oldest bridge in Bordeaux, and was the only bridge to cross the Garonne until 1965. Designed under Napoleon Bonaparte, Pont de Pierre has 17 arches‚Äîone for each letter in Napoleon‚Äôs full name.
sources.shortName: 3 Days in Bordeaux, France: Most Instagrammable Places

sources.snippet: One of the iconic sights in Bordeaux, the Pont de Pierre (Stone Bridge) spans the Garonne River with 17 graceful arches. Designed by engineer Claude Descamps, the Pont de Pierre was completed in 1821 after years of construction work. In the history of Bordeaux, this was the first bridge to cross the Garonne River.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Places to Visit in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: Pont the Pierre, or ‚ÄúSotney Bridge‚Äù, is Bordeaux‚Äôs best known bridge, spanning the Garonne River. Due to its ideal location, it is one of the locals‚Äô favorite places to watch the sunset. Pont de Pierre is a pedestrian/ bycicle /metro-only bridge, so you won‚Äôt have much of a problem taking pictures there.
sources.shortName: Ultimate Guide to the Best Photo Spots in Bordeaux

sources.snippet: Une publication partag√©e par Bordeaux Secret (@bordeaux__secret). Globalement, les ponts de la ville vous offrent des cadres magnifiques pour des shootings photos. Bien qu‚Äôils se suivent, ils ne se ressemblent pas et ont chacun un style unique.
sources.shortName: Bordeaux : 11 spots photo instagrammables

sources.snippet: Le pont de pierre est un lieu embl√©matique de Bordeaux, et id√©al pour se balader en fin de journ√©e ou le weekend. A pied ou √† v√©lo, il se parcoure tout en admirant la vue donnant sur la Garonne. Adresse : Pont de pierre, Bordeaux 33000.
sources.shortName: 10 Spots Photo √† Bordeaux pour illuminer votre Instagram

sources.snippet: Yes, the Pont de Pierre, Bordeaux's oldest bridge spanning the Garonne River, offers a fantastic view of the city's waterfront. This can make for dramatic Instagram shots, particularly at sunrise or sunset.
sources.shortName: Top Instagrammable Spots in Bordeaux

places.name: Pont de Pierre

reviews.text: Worth to see that water is yellow in Garrona. Nice place for taking a walk and/or run. Not too crowded by cars. Mainly public traffic and a lot of tourist. Good place to take a nice picture of Bordeaux river side.

Some great views, but on a hot Sunday morning in May, it was far too crowded with too many runners trying to keep their speed up and barging into pedestrians.  Plus a huge lack of people able to keep to the side of the path designated for walking in their direction.  The only place in Bordeaux we found so much congestion from people.
Great views and a nice sight to see in Bordeaux, but very busy
